Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Cliff House Hotel
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
“Cliff House Hotel” represents the reworking of a very recent soundtrack to a multimedia installation we created in an abandoned and mothballed mid-century boarding house/hotel in central Illinois. The exhibit was the third in a series of multimedia shows that employed abandoned places as a medium, rather than simply a venue. 



Anyway, this album is a detailed remix of numerous elements that were used in a video and quadraphonic sound system set up across two floors of the old hotel. The exhibit was called “Absence and Presence”, and that’s what this album is about as well.



Follow the stairs from street level, and mind your head….





Recorded December 2024

ADM 32

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Navigating Frozen Nigeria (2012) Remaster
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
The album “What is the Light of? was released in 2012 as a special edition CD-R package with an X-ray film stock cover, as well as an extended track on a second disc. That track, “Navigating Frozen Nigeria” was the result of a live-in-the-studio recording from the same period. The extended track was not included in the later digital download on Bandcamp. We can’t remember why. 

We have had several requests for the lost track, and so why not? We remastered it a bit, and it is now available here as a digital single.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Night Roar 2025
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
A little while ago, we released a new album as a digital download on Bandcamp. We were very pleased with the response, but also wanted to give a shout-out to a number of our listeners who chose the “pay more if you want” option that Bandcamp offers. Many of you were very generous, and we just wanted to let you know that the gesture is indeed appreciated. It’s heartening to see such responses to the work.

So, as a small thank you, we wanted to put out a new piece as a freebie. And that’s what we’re doing, as a free download on Bandcamp. However, we also had to record something that fits the current mood, and so we chose to remix something from our album “Land of Monkeys”, recorded during the first administration of the Angry Orange Man. Facing the same (or perhaps worse) climate as the last go-round, we chose a track suitably dark for the situation but perhaps surprisingly so as a gesture of thanks. But there you go…..

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: August 53rd
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
In 2018, our second vinyl release, “August 53rd ” appeared on Helen Scarsdale. The material was chosen as a follow-up to the previous vinyl release. However, much of the material predated that album. We’ve never had many words to describe August 53rd, and that may have something to do with the fact that it’s always been one of our favorites. 



So, six years later, we are releasing a digital version on Bandcamp – as originally mastered prior to remastering for vinyl, and also with an additional “Real Time” live-in-the-studio track.

trackinfo.title: The Failed Resurrection of Easy Listening

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Theme to Pillsburied (Mansion House Mix)
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
An outtake from an upcoming album, and a theme to be used in a live celebration in an abandoned flour mill this spring. Rave on, Doughboy...

Proceeds from sales of this track will go toward extension cords, hot glue, LEDs, and other accoutrements for a dead-place celebration in April.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Horde
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
“Horde” returns to the topic of emptied places, both artificial and authentic. And once again, those spaces are populated by various forms of decomposed resurrection, both artificial and authentic. Listeners will hear the familiar, the archaic, as well as some territory that hasn’t been previously explored.



If you or someone you know isn't familiar with our work, this is probably the place to start.



The new album is available both as a digital download and as a very limited physical edition consisting of two professionally duplicated pro-CDRs packaged in fire-damaged vintage fabrics. 



Recorded July 2022

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Reviving Seasonal Practices
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
The origins of this album have already become a little hazy for us. 

The recordings began in 2019, and continued through the pandemic. They harkened back to a time when our releases were heavily influenced by the season. These sessions (recorded during the months noted in the track titles) employed both elements used years earlier, alongside new material and processes. The result, we think, is a bucolic jaunt through a portion of yet another past calendar.



Recorded 2019-2021

ADM31

trackinfo.title: September: Native Response to the Question of Light

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Rusted Articles 1874 from 1968 (2020 Reconfiguration)
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
This album is actually a reconfigured hybrid of two very early recordings, neither of which we were particularly happy with in their original form. So, taking the liberty (as we do) to revise history, we’ve remastered the best bits of both albums and combined them into what is probably a much stronger thematic suite. Present in this album are pieces from our third CD-R release, “1874 from 1968”, which was only available for a short time nearly 20 years ago, as well as the majority of “The 31 Rusted Articles”, which was released a couple of years later. Both drew their inspiration from 19th-century American lore, as well as the coming of autumn. Remixes, reconfigurations, and everything remastered in 2020. As the man said, history is bunk.



ADM 30

2023

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Predicament Recordings Volume I 3.2020-5.2020
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
The first of two albums of material recorded during the Pandemic of 2020-21, but released after Volume 2. We aren’t sure why.



Field recordings, new recycled instruments, and a long-familiar isolation in method. Recorded March – May 2020.



ADM 28

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: The Recounting of Night Time
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
The Recounting of Night Time was composed and mixed in October of 2014. The source material focuses principally on a certain piece of German gothic cinema made during the late 1970s. This material was culled from both VHS audio tracks, as well a “field recording” made at a poorly-attended screening of the film in a decaying theater in St. Louis, Missouri sometime during the mid-1980s. 



Evidence of video control track glitches are present, while the scent of the acutely mildewed theater is recollected and implied.



ADM22



Released November 2018

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Scaath Catfish
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
Scaath Catfish was recorded in the spring of 2016, implementing field recordings made in the Illinois River valley and instrumental material found on a homemade cassette recording. The field recordings were made along the banks of a backwater lake and in the shadow of an aging power plant, following a spring flood. Twenty-six years earlier, one of the members of Fossil Aerosol purchased a homemade instrumental cassette tape recording (marked only “sacred”), at a thrift store in downtown St. Louis, Missouri. In 2016, fragments of the found cassette recordings were mixed with those made in the mud along the river.



ADM 24

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Ballad for C19
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about: Torn from the pages of today's headlines. Virus, blue badges, and minty biscuits.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: The Unlistening Place
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
The core tracks of The Unlistening Place were recorded in 2015. At the time, these were intended to be part of what was to be the final Fossil Aerosol album, scheduled for a distant release. But history circled back on itself and the result was a reworking of future tracks, alongside more new material. Historiography eating its own tail.



Tradition, referents, and resolute nothing from the place that does not hear.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: January 18 2018
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
If Fossil Aerosol got out more often, this is what it would sound like live. "January 18 2018" is a live,-in-the-studio improvisation made in the midst of a dark, very cold, and rather difficult winter. 



The last few years have seen a transition toward more software-based methodologies, but this one sent us back to our roots with a rack full of effects boxes, a proper mixing board, a little feedback, and the inevitable 60-cycle hum. 



A 38-minute, purposefully flawed winter song.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Objects of Disassociation Volume 1
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
Six artifacts with various provenance, bound together.



Over the past five years or so, we’ve recorded a number of pieces that, for various reasons, are not included in our catalog of released or unreleased albums. Sometimes, these tracks consist of live-in-the-studio experiments, revisits to old material, or simply thematic anomalies that we just can’t find a place for. These tracks are beginning to pile up, so we have assembled two albums worth of such orphans for digital release. 



Included in this first collection is an extended track (“Two Zeros in the Bottom Drawer”) composed of bits and pieces from our long-lost third release (1874 from 1968), which is been out of distribution for sometime. “Harps Head” is a live-in-the studio rendition using elements that were contributed to the collaborative “Patina Pooling" project with :zoviet*france:. "Cassette Opalescence" is a result of the rediscovery of a box of 4-track cassettes from the "Environmental Adjustments" sessions from 1997. Also included is a reconsideration of the obscured side of a certain lunar body, recently featured on the radio program "A Duck in a Tree".



(Note: we lowered the price on this one a bit, as it contains the track ”Cassette Opalescence”, which was previously offered as a single download on Bandcamp.)

trackinfo.title: Two Zeros in the Bottom Drawer (1874 from 1968 via 2016)

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Nigths and Profecy (Special Multimedia Edition)
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
“Nigths and Profecy” Special Multimedia Edition for 2021



In 2020, we revisited a much earlier project (“The First 15 Minutes of the Second Sequel”), which employed audio artifacts from a single, obscure zombie film released in 1980. This time around, we asked 400 Lonely Things to join us, and the result was a combined cassette, “Nigths and Profecy”, released by the Helen Scarsdale Agency.



To adapt to the cassette format, several tracks were left behind. For the summer of 2021, we are releasing the complete set of tracks from the original Fossil Aerosol sessions, as originally mastered for CD. This edition also includes a special remix of one of the longer tracks, as well as three short videos (totaling over 20 minutes) made from the original source material by filmmaker Matthew Konicek. These films are the closest visual expression of Fossil Aerosol that we have yet to see, and capture the character of the damaged fake decay of the early 1980s quite effectively. 



Over 80 minutes of multimedia, apocalyptic immersion.

ADM 26



VIDEOS

The videos are included as "bonus materials" in the download of the full album, and consist of three MP4 files: 



Etruscans Behind the Manor

Fake Tomb

Notti Reliquary

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Predicament Recordings Volume II  2.2021
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
Since the beginning of the 2020 pandemic, we have been observing how Fossil Aerosol has been imagining various forms of glitches in the comings and goings of modern society and consumer culture for a long time. We have also observed how utterly surprising the character of such an actual event has been, and how off-the-mark most of our imaginings turned out to be. 



Two albums of recordings were created during this time - between the late winter of 2020 and early 2021. The second will be released first. 



After nearly a year of isolation, a brief real-time, studio interaction happened in late February 2021, and resulted in a suite of recordings (Volume II) that were largely without theme or plan. No new source material had been collected, and instead was culled from a library of elements used in the previous 10 years of recordings. These were stripped from their original contexts, and a series of live-in-the-studio passages essentially made no attempt to observe the year 2020, a pandemic, or the end of yet another baffling US regime. 



Once again, looking backwards to see forward.



ADM 25

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Archaeological Testing in the Land of Monkeys
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
This unplanned and largely unannounced release consists of a suite of recordings initiated on Armistice Day and completed on the 278th birthday of Benedict Arnold. 



A fatigued response to reminders of a cyclical past, surprisingly exaggerated in the years of the rooster and the dog.



ADM23

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Zombi Traditions (37 Years)
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
Sounds from films about fake corpses constitute some of the earliest material used by Fossil Aerosol Mining Project, beginning with a section of a film trailer found in an abandoned drive-in movie theater in 1983. The first full-length album to focus on the topic was “if you loved the dawn of the dead”, which was a digital-only release on iTunes about 15 years ago and which has since been pulled from distribution. Some of the material from that album was remixed for the 2009 “Resurrection Remixes.” But we were still weren’t convinced. So, in 2014 we created the compilation “Zombi Traditions”, which like its predecessors was released as a digital download only. Meanwhile, “The First 15 Minutes of the Second Sequel” (2008), and last year’s “Nigths and Profecy” also dealt with artifacts of the imagined zombie apocalypse.



 During all of this reanimated revisionism, certain tracks were left behind while other tracks merited remastering or even remixing. So, during the lockdown last year, that’s what we did. We addressed the entire zombie back catalog, culling from it what we thought was the strongest and most representative material, remixing or remastering just about everything, and at the same time pulling in the missing pieces. 



The result is a fifteen-song collection of synthetic resurrections from the Reagan Era - our desert-island selection of fake dead bodies and the worlds created for them.



This album is available here in 3 versions: a full resolution download, a professionally duplicated pro-CDR, and a special edition (limited to 50 copies) that features hand-crafted, artificial skin covers and a download code pointing to an additional 40 minutes of material.



ADM 27

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: 17 Years in Ektachrome
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
Full resolution digital download version of the 2014 CD released by Hand-Held Recordings. This release includes an outtake from the original 2011 sessions, previously unreleased.

The damaged documents and pilfered souvenirs of a very long journey.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: The Day 1982 Contaminated 1971
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
With this album, Fossil Aerosol returns to the damaged media and decomposing mediums of the late 20th century. The basic tracks were recorded in 2010, and were remixed and remastered in 2014. The source material for the work consists of dissociated fragments from nearly-lost genre films of the 1970s, filtered by scratched celluloid, bad splices, dropouts, and damaged control tracks.



The Day 1982 Contaminated 1971 was released on vinyl by the Helen Scarsdale Agency in 2015. The first 200 copies of the pressing included fragments of 1970s intermission film, recovered from an abandoned drive-in theater during the early 1980s and affixed to the cover art of the album.



This digital version includes "Noice, Coak, and Pre-1982 Occurrences", an extended / remix track that incorporates elements from several pieces on the LP.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Telegnostic Devices
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
Recorded during the winter of 2012 whilst examining too many obscure paranormal documentaries of the 1970s. 2012-2015 was a very busy period in the studio, and this album was lost in the shuffle. Digital download only, in an effort to keep current, at least by the decade. Also, the track "From 1860" really is.



ADM17

This anniversary year will see several new releases on various forms of thermoplastic polymers. The backlog of completed unreleased albums, however, is such that it is unlikely all will find their way to CD or vinyl any time soon. And as we generally release the work in roughly chronological order, the most recent material tends not be heard for some time. So this spring, we’ve decided to flip the timetable and release a new suite of recordings as they are finished.



The core tracks of 3.2016 were mixed during March of 2016. On the 23rd of the month, elements from several of these tracks were reanimated live in the studio under a Paschal Moon. The result was an additional 23 minutes of real-time compositions.



3.2016 is being made available immediately upon completion as a full-resolution download, while the tiny ones and zeros are still warm.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Revisionist History
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
"Revisionist History" observes 30 years of obscure, sporadic, and artificial resurrection. The recordings on this album are hybrids, created by the grafting of old artifacts onto new material using recently devised studio processes. New sounds of the past, articulated through the devices of an unimagined future.



This Bandcamp digital version of the album includes the original 10 tracks, along with 4 of the bonus tracks from the "virtual second disk" included in the physical CD release (2016), limited to 300 copies.



ADM19

trackinfo.title: (bonus track) Respect for the Mechanism - lignum vers

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
The very first mixes that were made under the moniker Fossil Aerosol Mining Project date to January or February of 1986. They were produced on the floor of a 2-room apartment, using three effects pedals (one of which gave a nasty little 9-volt shock), two radio/cassette players (one utilized for its bad source switch), some recordings of a Moog Prodigy made three years earlier, and a Radio Shack four-channel mixer. The result was a series of long, improvised mixes that were soon forgotten, and replaced by very different strategies in the studio. 



In February of 2016, in observation of the 30th anniversary of sitting on the floor and receiving minor shocks as we embarked on the Fossil Aerosol project, we created a new, 23-minute extended mix that employs only material recorded and/or mixed during those first winter 1986 sessions. The piece is a 2016 composition, but it is built entirely of 1986 - turned inside out and frontways back 30 years later.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: What is the Light of?
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
First released in 2013, this album is based on a series of live-in-the-studio recordings made during the early winter of 2012. This version includes several remixes or alternate versions of tracks from the original release. 

Invitations to real-time malfunction.



(note: for those that purchased the original version of this album, the alternate version tracks may be downloaded individually here)

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Some Historical Shrines of 1934
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
In 2015, Fossil Aerosol worked with filmmaker Matthew Konicek on the soundtrack to his new video short, "Some Historical Shrines of 1934". Using a unique process that affects both the video and audio tracks, the film is an exploration of hyper-manipulated time and the inadvertent layering of history.

Using the looped audio from the original rough cut of the video footage, Fossil Aerosol recomposed selected fragments employing their own time-compression techniques, creating a 15-minute, freestanding composition. Portions of that composition were then used in the final cut of the film, which also reintroduced real-time, looped elements from the footage. This track is the original 15-minute cut.

"Some Historical Shrines of 1934" can be seen here: 
vimeo.com/125835732

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Red Fades First
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about: Red Fades First was recorded during a heat wave in the summer of 2013. The project explored the effects of mildew on chromium oxide, and of chromium oxide on mildew. The complexities of a damaged spectrum.

trackinfo.title: Just Past Dawn, Seven Hours East

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Three Days at Qurna
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about: Observing the commodity of antiquity and the fakery of the ancient.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Cassette Recordings 1983-1995 (remastered)
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about: The Cassette Recordings CD-R was released in 1995 and contained some of our earliest work, recorded and mixed on 4-track cassette decks during the mid-late 1980s. Included were tracks from the first two cassette releases (1987 & 1988), as well as previously unreleased material. The tracks were remastered in 2019 for this digital release.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: About Your Belief (remastered)
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
Long out of circulation, our 4th CD-R release was remastered and expanded in 2019. As is our custom, we’ve monkeyed with the history a bit, resulting in more revisionism along with a much-improved frequency response. 



The original 2005 release represented the first set of recordings produced by a reassembled Fossil Aerosol Mining Project, using new equipment (actually postdating the Reagan administration) and revised delay processes.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Mutations and Synthetics
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
Recorded in 2006, this album was composed of relics from poorly-crafted media fantasies of a malfunctioning future and a mutated pop culture. Layered voices of extinct synthesizers, punctuated by the stutters and blips of fake technology. Mutations and Synthetics was available as a digital download for a time, and most of the CD-Rs were sold in Japan. Then it disappeared.



The 2023 release consists of all remastered tracks, as well as an extra track that contains material from the 2006 sessions.



The future from the past.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Environmental Adjustments, March 1997
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
"Environmental Adjustments" was the second Fossil Aerosol CD-R release by Afterdays Media. The 4-track cassette recordings were made in the early spring of 1997, using then-new processes that provided for more live improvisation in the studio. 

The sounds of a contaminated thaw.

Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.title: Very Early Fragments
Fossil Aerosol Mining Project.about:
Very Early Fragments was recorded over a period of several winters, using source material dating to the earliest years of Fossil Aerosol. This reissue includes several alternate versions and outtakes. Tracks 1, 3, 5 and 6 differ from the original iTunes release. 



Chromium dioxide clinging to the tape heads, filtering late 20th century media.
